article.headline: W. Carolina 87, Methodist 76
article.story: CULLOWHEE, N.C. (AP) -- Nick Aldridge scored 22 points to lead Western Carolina to an 87-76 victory over Methodist on Wednesday night. Michael Porrini added 15 points and 10 rebounds and Brandon Giles had 13 points for the Catamounts (2-2), who snapped a two-game losing streak. Western Carolina shot 51.4 percent, outrebounded Division III Methodist 43-30 and scored 28 points off 25 turnovers by the Monarchs. Billy McDade led Methodist with 17 points, Brian Lane had 15, Travis McBryde scored 12 and A.B. Lehman had 11 points. The latest meeting between the cross-state schools was closer than most. Western Carolina had won the previous five meetings by an average of nearly 36 points, and the Catamounts won the most recent meeting in 1986 by 61 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
